message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.NE 

The paper deals with entropy and information theory, which suggests that it belongs to the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category. It also involves Markov chains and their properties, which could place it in the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category. The use of statistical methods and analysis of the Hidden Markov Chain could also make it relevant to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves modeling and estimation, which could place it in the cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) sub-category. Finally, the use of rare transitions and asymptotic estimates could make it relevant to the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
